Dear Mr. Millikin:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.

ALLEGATION: A foster care worker was having an intimate relationship with their
direct client on a foster care case.
INVESTIGATION:
It was discovered that Foster Care Worker 1 was having an intimate relationship with
his direct client on a foster care case. There are concerns that Foster Care Worker 1
used his position of authority to pursue a relationship with the client. Law enforcement
is involved, and employment of Foster Care Worker 1 was terminated.
2

I interviewed Administrator 1 by telephone on 03/14/2022. Administrator 1 stated it had
been reported that Foster Care Worker 1 was involved in an inappropriate intimate
relationship with a foster care client on Foster Care Worker 1’s caseload. Administrator
1 stated Foster Care Worker 1 admitted to the relationship and a termination of
employment agreement was negotiated with Foster Care Worker 1. The termination of
employment of Foster Care Worker 1 was effective 03/04/2022. Administrator 1 stated
law enforcement had also been notified due to the concern Foster Care Worker 1 had
used his position of authority as a part of establishing the inappropriate relationship.
I received the requested information from Administrator 1 on 03/14/2022. The
information included a copy of the termination agreement that was negotiated with
Foster Care Worker 1 as well as the identity of the children and mother with whom
Foster Care Worker 1 had the relationship.
I interviewed Administrator 1 by telephone on 05/05/2022. Administrator 1 confirmed it
was the mother of the children in care who first reported the situation. Administrator 1
reported the children in care had been returned to the mother and she was concerned
what influence her relationship with Foster Care Worker 1 may have on the children
remaining in her care. Administrator 1 also provided contact information for law
enforcement.
I interviewed law enforcement by telephone on 05/05/2022. Law Enforcement reported
the related case was still open and no determination had yet been made.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12206 Staff qualifications
(1) An agency shall require a staff member who has
ongoing contact with children or parents to be a person
who has the ability, experience, education, and training to
perform the duties assigned.
ANALYSIS: The findings of this investigation determined that Foster Care
Worker 1 did engage in an inappropriate relationship with the
mother of children under Foster Care Worker 1’s supervision.
Foster Care Worker 1 acknowledged the relationship and
negotiated a termination agreement with the agency. The
outcome of law enforcement involvement is yet to be
determined.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
3

IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend with the submission and acceptance of an approved corrective action
plan the current license status of this child placing agency be maintained.
